description: This grazing board combines sweet and halal savory elements that are perfect for an Eid celebration.
headline: How I Create an Eid Grazing Board with Halal Goodies
name: How I Create an Eid Grazing Board with Halal Goodies
recipeIngredient: 2 (about 9-ounce) triple creme Brie cheese rounds, divided
3 tablespoons za'atar seasoning, plus more if desired
2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more if desired
8 ounces thinly sliced cured halal beef
8 ounces halal beef sausage, sliced into rounds
6 pieces baklava topped with pistachios and/or pieces of chocolate

recipeInstructions.text: Use a star-shaped cookie cutter to cut 1 Brie cheese round into a star shape. Cut the second Brie cheese round into 1/4-inch squares. Place the star-shaped Brie near the center of large serving board. Slightly overlap the Brie slices and fan them out next to the star-shaped Brie.
Cut a 1-pound Gouda cheese piece into a crescent moon shape and add it to the board.

Place 1 cup labneh, 3 tablespoons za'atar, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper in a small bowl and stir until combined. Top with more olive oil and zaatar, if desired. Place on the board.

Arrange 8 ounces thinly sliced halal beef on the board, folding and bunching the slices artfully. Cut 8 ounces halal beef sausage crosswise into rounds. Arrange them on another section of the board, slightly overlapping the slices.
Arrange 6 Kahk El Eid, 6 pieces baklava, 6 pieces asawer el sit, 3 ghorayeba topped with almonds, and 3 apricot jam cookies in clusters in some of the empty spaces around the board.
Arrange 6 ounces dried apricots, 6 ounces walnuts, and 3 bunches grapes cut into smaller clusters in the remaining spaces on the board.
